info.document:
American cruiser major UM Motorcycles sees India as a hub, from where it plans to export to the European markets in the months to come.

UM Motorcycles, the Indian arm of Miami-based UM International in JV with Lohia Auto, has been retailing motorcycles in India for almost a year now, selling 10,000 units over the last 10 months. Its Indian stable consisted of the Renegade Commando and Renegade Sport S, which were joined by Renegade Mojave and Renegade Classic on Wednesday, priced Rs 1.85 lakh and Rs 1.95 lakh (ex-showroom Bengaluru) respectively. As part of its Europe push, the company sells cruisers in the UK, Spain, Portugal, Germany, and Austria currently, adding Italy next year, through export from its Thailand and China facilities.

"In the coming months, we'll be exporting to the European markets from India. Our facility at Kashipur in Uttarakhand, with an annual capacity of 50,000 units, is capable of handling the demand," UM India Director Jose Villegas told DH.

The company has also set out on a robust India road map over the next 18 months, by when it will open its second facility, somewhere in Maharashtra, with a capacity of 1,20,000 units. There are plans to set up an R&D centre in the state as well, which will see an investment of Rs 100 crore. "Currently, localisation in India is at 72%, f, while we import some components from Europe, China, Thailand and Japan. With the second plant, we'll set up a 100% local engine plant, scaling up overall localisation gradually," Villegas said.The four models in UM's stable run on 279.5 cc powertrains, and boa st of many stylish, yet relevant features. Sensing little or no competition in the Rs 1.5 lakh to Rs 2 lakh classic (cruiser) segment, UM claims 50% share.
